sentences: Delegates continued discussions on the Bonn Agreements at COP-7 and SB-15 in Marrakesh, Morocco, from 29 October to 10 November 2001.

After lengthy negotiations, a package deal on LULUCF, mechanisms, Protocol Articles 5 (methodological issues), 7 (communication of information) and 8 (review of information), and input to the World Summit on Sustainable Development (WSSD) was proposed on 8 November.
Although the deal was accepted by most regional groups, some Annex I Parties, including Australia, Canada, Japan, New Zealand, and the Russian Federation, did not join the consensus.
They disputed, among other things, eligibility requirements and credit banking under the mechanisms.

However, following extensive negotiations, the 'Marrakesh Accords' were agreed, with key features including consideration of LULUCF Principles and limited banking of units generated by sinks under the CDM.
